title: Bilingual Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (West Springfield, MA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for this position. The first interview was over the phone, and it consisted of a recruiter explaining the job to me and letting me know someone would reach out. The second and third interviews were virtual, and I met with the Regional Supervisor both times. During the interview, I was asked about career goals, personal experiences, etc., and given various scenarios. Since I applied for the Bilingual position, some of the scenarios were presented in Spanish, and I had to respond in Spanish. After the third interview, I was told that a Clinical Coordinator would call me, but I never heard from them. In total, I'd say the entire process took about a month.
Interview Questions: Based on this client's needs, what would you prioritize first?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Greensboro, NC) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: There is a rigorous interview post screening that consists of in-depth questions on scenarios and experience related to work with at-risk juveniles. Also, be prepared to elaborate on every response and give personal experiences as they relate to your work history.
Interview Questions: • Give a scenario is in which you had disagreements with management/coworkers. •Provide a time in which you struggled during your shift and what you did to overcome it.

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: After over a month of interviews, I was denied after being asked to provide a list of the pros and cons of the organization. The interviews included a site visit.
Interview Questions: How do you relate to different ethnicities and cultural backgrounds?

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Asheville, NC) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was an email, then a phone call, then an in person meeting and then a job offer. They were pleasant and easy to communicate with. I didn't choose to move for the job but respect the company and would enjoy working for them.
Interview Questions: What do you enjoy most about fundraising?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Woburn, MA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Pre screen (getting to know you, job description, benefits, scenarios, explanation of why you want to do this), formal interview, possibly a third interview with the entire team if they think you will fit in with their values
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Screening call- reviewed position, benefits, training process, asked about my interest and experience, allowed time for questions. This was not a formal interview but the step prior to that. Will follow up in a week to schedule an interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions:
3 interviews 
Phone, 2 in person 
A ton of situational questions 
The interviews aren’t very hard. They are going to ask about previous experience with children and the why behind working at youth villages. (Why do you want to work with children with mental illness and behavioral issues?)
Interview Questions: Have you ever told your supervisor something that you didn’t have to tell them? Give an example.

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Johnson City, TN) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Lots of scenarios. Difficult to articulate the answers on the spot but the interviewers offer guidance. Do t let your nerves get to you. They look for confidence. I don’t know what else to say to make this 30 words.
Interview Questions: What issue from said scenario would you prioritize?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: The actual interview was long. You cannot just wing this one. I applied for a remote position so my interview was on Zoom. This was in May 2022. You will need to know how to provide services and essentially assess what services would be needed in a scenario for the interview.
Interview Questions: The employer will provide you with a few different scenarios and you will have to assess the services the family may need.

title: Youth Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Springfield, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview Process was sloppy and disorganized, staff seemed overwhelmed. Hiring manager was constantly busy or unresponsive. It has taken me over a month to hear back, and I keep getting "we will contact you soon" responses both via email and via phone. It has been over two months of the same response with no concrete answer. Also, the interviewer would not let me finish my responses. I am overqualified for this job and am seeing a lot of red flags so far as someone who already works I the field.
Interview Questions: Describe How you would respond in x situation

title: Crisis Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: i had three total interviews, each were pretty laid back, especially the first one. the first one seemed to gauge whether i met the requirements for the job, the second and third were more about being a good fit for the position in terms of quality of care and ability to thrive in that type of environment (working in the field, no office, weekly schedule shifts)
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about your experience working with kids?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was very fair and timely. I didn't think they asked any crazy, unexpected questions. They were very honest about how the job really is and the types of people you may be working with.
Interview Questions: what would you do in certain scenerios

title: Social Work Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly straightforward.  After filling out the initial application online, which included some discussion type questions,  I was contacted to set up a phone interview.  The phone interview was thorough, and the interviewer was pleasant and easy to talk to rather than intimidating.  After the phone interview round, they extended me an offer.
Interview Questions:
How would you handle a conflict between two teenagers in the treatment center or group home?

Name a time you had to remain calm under stressful or chaotic circumstances and describe how you handled the situation.  

What do you know about HIPAA?

title: Family Peer Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Asheville, NC) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: One interviewer was in her car, another had an artificial background. One interviewer was in a hoodie & messy t-shirt. There were weird expectations that were unspoken until after the interview. They made judgements on assumptions that also no sense.
Interview Questions: There were several scenario questions that specifically concerned cultural differences. And questions about the profession to make sure people know what they're talking about.

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Quick interview process, first was a phone screening followed by a formal interview. Lastly I had to do a presentation.
Overall I had a very positive and helpful interview process.
Interview Questions: Situational questions and making a presentation.

title: Life Set Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was straight forward. It was many scenarios questions that requires alot of thought. it is okay to have a pause in between questions. If the questions are long, it is okay to ask to repeat it. The interviewers are very nice and sweet.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you was apart of a group and what was your role?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Knoxville, TN) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Was good! Try to make it personable with them to stand out amongst the other interviewers. Try not to stress out too much. Think smart and think about scenario questions
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Recruiting Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward. Series of interviews with team members. Typical questions with an overview of responsibilities and time left for questions and answers. Follow up with results was always within 24 hours.
Interview Questions: How do I handle stress?

title: Residential Night Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Fast paced. You do have to take a physical for the job which is definitely a work out. Some staff were required to run/ walk a mile I’m not sure if that still applies
Interview Questions:
Have you ever worked with disadvantaged youth?
Would you be able to handle several youth in a room making loud noises and attention seeking?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and fair interview process. Over the phone for initial consult, followed by an in-person interview with two program managers. They got back to me with an offer of employment in a timely manner.
Interview Questions: What skills do you posses that are suited for this role?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy. There were case scenario questions and also adequate time to ask my own questions of the employer.  There were multiple interviews where I spoke with two different staff members.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in treatment planning?

title: Youth Behavior Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It went very smooth and just be yourself! Don't get nervous and take a deep breathe. Do some research before you apply for YV. You go into the site and check in first,but before that they send you a notification
Interview Questions: Why would like to work for YV

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: It was a typical interview. They asked questions and I answered.  The first interview was over the phone and the second in person.  But did sceneries.  They did review that there would be lots of travel.
Interview Questions: They did tile playing but I don’t remember much else.

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Knoxville, TN) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough but super easy. Asks a lot of scenarios and how you would handle situations. Asked about work history and education experience. Wanted to understand your knowledge about keeping kids and youth safe.
Interview Questions: Safety based questions about youth and different circumstances

title: Night Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy-Goes quickly, you will have a phone interview and several face to face. Then background-drug test and afterwards an offer. I think it takes several weeks to actually be hired.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you couldnt get a job done.

title: Behavioral Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: They were late multiple times to the process, but they were very attentive and enthusiastic when actually interviewing me. I really enjoyed talking with the multiple people, but I did feel a bit neglected with the multiple instances of tardiness. I think it’s the nature of the company though.
Interview Questions: What’s been the biggest challenge in your work life?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Amazing process! Supervisor work hard to help you transition smooth into the company. Orientation is amazing! They do a lot to make sure you feel comfortable and competent. It was pretty easy to completely the interview and Onboarding.
Interview Questions: If you saw someone violating and breaking ethics what would you do?

title: SCSS Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: My process was overall very pleasant. It was a very easy and structured  process. Human Resources kept me informed and training was excellent. They pride themselves in educating their employed and making sure they can grow and feel comfortable making decisions on there own.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with  children who may be having suicidal ideations?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: 90 minutes interview with very deficit oriented questions like „Describe a situation in your last position where you violated HIPPA“ or „When was there a situation where you did not want to go to work anymore but decided to do so nevertheless.“ plus two cases at the end verbally explained where I had to answers 3 questions about each of them what felt like sitting in an oral exam.
Interview Questions: Tons of questions about where I failed in my last work places or specific situations or where I got criticized or violated HIPPA

title: LifeSet Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Boston, MA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pretty intense , many scenarios but great. Very friendly, needs clear cut answers, be confident. Dont feel worried about the second interview its pretty chill. You will do great, if you know what you want to touch on.
Interview Questions: Whats one critique you got from a supervisor?

title: Business Planning and Policy Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: This position will be responsible for supporting Youth Villages business development, strategy, and government relations work. In addition to implementing programs directly, Youth Villages also trains and supports other organizations (partners) to implement our models. This position will focus on supporting partner service-provision growth and sustainability, new business development and expansion, and public policy efforts in assigned states and new expansion initiatives in states where we do not yet have a presence.
Interview Questions: Child well fair agency experience

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Knoxville, TN) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a bit excessive. The pay for the position isn't great and they require three interviews. The hold an intake interview, a second interview, and then a final one if they ask you to do so.
Interview Questions: They asked a series of rapid fire questions

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Plano, IA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
very textbook interview questions so study up on those before you interview takes place
make sure you have experiences you can talk about and bring to the table
Interviewer was very easy to talk to
about a one hour phone call
Interview Questions: What is a weakness you have

title: Behavioral Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Several interviews. Pre-screen, video, in-person. The interviews were pretty informative and asked standard questions related to the job, wanted to know how you would handle situations. They were good interviews, giving a good amount of information about what they were looking for and offered.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a child that started to fight another one?

title: Foster Care Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Prescreen interview with description of the position and some relaxed interview questions, next interview with a supervisor that is also over the phone and more formal questions, and a final zoom interview with another supervisor that is structured with typical interview questions and some scenarios.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a conflict at work? Provide an example

title: Youth Behavioral Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Douglasville, GA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: It consisted of 3 interviews. The first was a screening interview, then there was a phone interview, and last it was in person. They were pretty good about responding and the whole process went pretty quickly.
Interview Questions: A lot of situational questions asking how you would act in certain situations!

title: Family Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone prescreen interview first where they asked a few structured questions and went over the specifics of the job, then a phone interview with a supervisor where the interview was more structured, then a final zoom interview with the hiring supervisor
Interview Questions: How would you address a situation in which a child in foster care became aggressive during a home visit?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screen a couple of days after I applied and so far the process has taken almost a month. I have had to constantly reach out to get follow up.
Interview Questions: Why youth villages?

title: Night Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: The man was very nice and took the time to listen to me. It was a bit nerve-racking because it was the first call and I have never done a phone interview before.
Interview Questions: how would you get a restless child to go back to sleep inorder to not disturb the other children

title: Foster Parent Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, phone interview they gave a large detail of the job. it was helpful and they asked basic questions she was nice and made sure i knew about the large amounts of neediness for the job
Interview Questions: What do you think a foster parent recruiter does

title: Behavioral Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a prescreen  interview. I was contacted the same day for my interview with the hiring manager. My interview with the hiring manager was canceled due to an emergency. I rescheduled my interview a couple days later. I finally had interview with an hiring manager, and now an interview with the director of the program.
Interview Questions: If someone was to spit in my face , how would I handle this situation?

title: Behavioral Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of many questions and were scenario based. Be prepared to talk about your previous experience and situations in which you've encountered a child considered to have behavioral problems. How did you respond? How would you respond?
Interview Questions: Why do you think children have behavioral problems?

title: High Fidelity Wraparound Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Charlotte C H, VA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Difficult process to navigate. They were quick to hire and seem to do so often. The process included 2 interviews with different people but same questions. Involving hypothetical situations and how you would address a crisis.
Interview Questions: What is your background in?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Asheville, NC) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview and then Zoom interview scheduled due to Covid. Communication was clear and process was smooth, especially under the current pandemic circumstances and stressors. Job duties were described very clearly during the second interview.
Interview Questions: Gave scenarios to test skills in creating goals/objectives for possible  treatment plans for case conceptualizations.

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied on indeed its was a 4 week process 2 phone interviews a 1 in person the i had to wait for orientation but it was easy flow over all the hiring manager was very nice i was comfortable so i think i went well.
Interview Questions: What was something that made me feel under pressure

title: Clinical Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Two over the phone interviews. One is a pre-screen and the second is an actual interview. The calls were roughly 30 minutes each and I would definition recommend studying their website before hand. The hiring manager interviewing is from one of the specific locations so it’s best to be knowledgeable about the house you may be previously working at. Have questions ready for them already written down so you don’t trip over yourself trying to think of questions throughout
Interview Questions: Was there a time were your clients had cultural differences and how did you handle it

title: Intercept In Home Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter called with date and time for interview. The supervisor that was to interview me rescheduled twice. Interview questions were basic questions you find online and she was basically reading them off a piece of paper.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a co-worker and how you handled it.

title: Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: On 4th interview. How many more? Asked the same questions by the same people. Just redundant if you ask me.  They could be a little less painful in this. They say they will call and never do. I had to place phone calls myself.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Life Set Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Knoxville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: I applied via Indeed.com and was e-mailed a few days later to complete a phone screening. The phone screening included a description of the job and if the candidate is able to meet the requirements. There were scenarios given in regard to children and a job specific scenario.
Interview Questions: How would you assist a 19 year old male with independent living skills?

title: Clinical Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: First completed a phone screen interview which was an overview of the position. Next I received a phone call with the manager to schedule a face to face interview. The face to face interview was structured. They asked questions about my work experience and my work ethics. I was offered the position the following day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience, what is your preferred style of supervision, how would you handle working with aggressive patients

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions:
No Offer

I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ProviderTrust in March 2019.

t starts with a quick phone call to go over the company and hear a little about the candidate. This is followed by a few technical questions in SQL and Java. Then they finish up with Q&A.
Interview Questions: Review a pre-written program.

title: Overnight Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Arlington, TN) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a phone interview about a week later. The phone interview was easy and just asked if I know anything about Youth Village. 2 weeks later, they called me for my first interview. The interview was easy and pleasant. The lady was really nice and made me feel comfortable. It was a 30 min process. A week later, I received another call for my second interview.
Interview Questions: What kind of activities would you suggest that will help kids cope with stress?

title: Intercept In Home Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Tulsa, OK)
Interview Descriptions: I completed three interviews.  The first interview was by telephone, basically a screener who is actually housed in another state.  This interview took about 20 minutes. The second interview was with a supervisor from the actual work site, via telephone.  This interview was much more job specific and lasted over an hour. At this point I had several questions and took LOTS of notes. The third interview was a panel interview with 2 supervisors and the regional director.  It was a pretty thorough interview where responses to scenarios were required. I was not offered the job on the spot. They notified me by phone the next day.
Interview Questions: How I would respond to certain specific escalated situations with youth involved who were in crisis.

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position, set up the phone screening appointment. Went through 30 minutes of a conversation with a really pleasant recruiter. Got to the end and she started to lay out the salary and benefits. The hourly rate for the position was VERY low for the position, responsibilities, and market.   I opted not to go further in the process.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to deal with a customer/client that was angry, and how you handled it.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Jackson, MS) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview then in person. Lots of scenarios questions. They interview 30 plus ppl so you have to.really impress at the interview because the amount of ppl being interviewed for one position
Interview Questions: What community resources would you use to help your clients

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (East Fayetteville, NC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter called within 24 hours of submitting the online application. She scheduled a brief screening interview. It consisted of an overview of the job. Then I had an in-person interview at the office.
Interview Questions: You are working with a youth who ran away from home. What would you do?

title: Foster Care Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I received an email about completed the step 2 application part and was asked to set up a phone call interview for later in the week. The phone call was about 30 minutes and asked about past experience and told me someone would call later in the week to set up an in person interview. I received a call about an hour later to set up the interview and will have the interview next week.
Interview Questions: Q: What is your previous job experience?

title: Family Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was pleasant and informative. Questions were straightforward. Interviewer was pleasant and respectful. A series of phone interviews were conducted. Much information was provided regarding case load, responsibilities, and training.
Interview Questions: What goals do you have for the future?

title: Crisis Response Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Two interviews. One asked a lot of questions that I think were attempts to screen people who were racists or would impose their religious values on clients. Most questions asked for examples, i.e. "Tell me about a time when..."
The second interview involved two scenarios. I was asked what further information I would want and about what I thought would be the best course of action.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when your quick action kept a situation from getting worse.

title: Primary Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Brandon, MS) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by email a day after I applied to set up a phone interview. Interview lasted around 30 minutes where I was asked about my experience and told about the salary and benefits and about the orientation requirements
Interview Questions: What experience I had with case management/documentation

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR they asked which days I was available and sent me for a drug test. I then signed the paperwork and was told that they would call me when training began.
Interview Questions: What days are you available

title: Life Skills Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Boone, NC) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initially contacted for a phone interview with talent acquisition. They asked general questions about my background and education and then went over a brief detail of the position. It lasted maybe 15 minutes. They forwarded my information to the general supervisor for the position and he contacted a week later to set up an interview at his office. It lasted about an hour, he asked probably 10-15 questions which had already been typed up on a sheet of paper. He forwarded the information to the regional supervisor and I was contacted the next day for a third interview. Meet with that supervisor the next week and she had another sheet of paper with probably 10-15 more questions. Those were mostly case study type questions.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Bartlett, TN) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Pre screen interview in the phone. Basic questions about why I want to work there, my experience with at risked youth and how I feel about breaking up fight, which may occur.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations?

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with a recruiter over the phone, fast and easy! They did take their time offering a job, but i was really happy when i finally got the job offer.
Interview Questions:
What would make you the best candidate for this job?
Tell me about your previous experience?
What courses did you take in undergrad that has prepared you for this role?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, it was not super long. The interviewer answered all of the questions that I had. He also explained how the process of hiring at Youth Villages, also the licensure process in another state
Interview Questions: What theories do I use.

title: Behavioral Youth Counselor Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: First I did a phone interview and it went well, and the person told me that I was moving on to the next phase of the interview process. Two days later a supervisor called me and I interviewed two more times. I also had to take an agility test to get to the 2nd in person interview.
Interview Questions: Did I have any experience with youth?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Savannah, GA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Not difficult and average. Interview was good and friendly person asking the questions. I felt comfortable with the process. Just relax and be yourself and try not to over think it.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Why did you apply here?

title: LifeSet Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Completed the online application and was contacted by a recruiter. The recruiter asked me questions about my background before connecting me to the assistant state director for my first interview over the phone. After the phone interview a second in-person interview with the regional director.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you think you may have difficulty with the job.

title: Clinical Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Youth Villages recruiter helped me set up interview with Main counselor and Supervisor who both interviewed me and asked a several questions. They also said I could ask questions of them regarding the program, job duties, etc. at any time. Told me they'd be meeting with other applicants but would get back with me within a week for a second interview/job offer.
Interview Questions: What are some qualities you look for in a supervisor?

title: Family Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was an online interview and then a 40-minute phone screen. It was not too terribly difficult. Quick online application. I just finished the interview so I have not yet received an offer; my interviewer said they would get back to me soon.
Interview Questions: What is a challenge that you face in the workplace?

title: Masters Level Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Douglasville, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Repeatedly missed appointments to call and never responded to emails.  Set up phone interview, stated they would call, didn’t call, I emailed, they didn’t answer and so on and so forth for over a month.  2 months later told me I didn’t get the job.  Seems like their organization related to the hiring process needs work.  I would understand if it were someone working as a counselor/staff but this was all from the “hiring manager”.
Interview Questions: Never got to this point

title: Summer Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: They gave me a Question & Answer reference form for three people to fill out.  The Interview lasted about 30 minutes.  Also, there was a long checklist that had to be filled out online. This took a couple of hours.
Interview Questions: Name a time when a child got physical with you. How did you respond?

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back. I enjoyed the interview and They asked good questions. We eventually started talking and so we knew each other, we had a lot in common and the interview was really laid-back and the girls were really cool.
Interview Questions: What would I do in a violent situation

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: It was a very easy interview. I was an intern before I got hired full time. The interview questions was very easy questions. If you didn’t get the job then you must of been really bad!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Started the interview process with recruiter. Got a email about 2 weeks after applying. The recruiter was friendly but did not know much about the job. The next phone interview was with the HM. HM was very personable but did not stay on subject during the interview. It was hard to know whether I should have side bar conversations or try to keep the interview on track. Received a email saying I would not be moving forward in the process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourseld

title: Behavioral Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN)
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview and then a in person. I then went for a second interview which was a observation. Now I have to finish agility requirements. Very simple
Interview Questions: What does self discipline mean to you?

title: Crisis Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Portland, OR) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview is easy they ask about background and give you an overview of the position, benefits, and company. 2nd interview they give scenarios and ask more questions related to the position.
Interview Questions:
How do you handle crisis situations?
Your experience with a difficult employee, how did you handle it?

title: Foster Care Trainer & Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Knoxville, TN) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 phases to the interview process. I met with the direct supervisor, her supervisor and then the two of them together. It was easy and straightforward. They asked great questions, but looking back I should have asked more specific questions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Family Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of two phone interviews, one in person interview, and one ride along to a counseling session.  Overall, it took about two weeks to complete the entire process and an additional week to get the background check/drug test results back.
Interview Questions: Scenarios, word association

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: There was a lengthy application process with educational background required. There was a phone interview with one individual, then 2 in person interviews. It took approximately 2.5 months from beginning to end.
Interview Questions: What theory do you use when working with clients?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Indianapolis, IN) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I put my name down to be contacted by a recruiter at a career fair. About two months later, I was contacted. Once the interview process started, it took about 2 weeks. One phone interview and one in person with HR and a supervisor. I was asked 1 situational question over the phone and three in person. After I responded to the situational questions, I was given feedback so that was great. Overall, it seemed like a more informative interview to ensure I would be okay with all that the job required
Interview Questions: How much driving would you expect to do per day?

title: Wraparound Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is super long. You have three interviews, one phone with hr and then two face to face. It took over two months to complete. Then they have you do a ride along.
Interview Questions: They asked about your experience working in the field of mental health

title: LifeSet Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed and told I would get a response by the end of the week. Within a few hours I received a phone call from the interview offing me the job.
Interview Questions: Lots of scenario questions

title: Transitional Living Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Tulsa, OK) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview was more about giving me information about the job as far as compensation and what they offer. Then I was given about 5 different scenario questions base around how they handle real life cases.
Interview Questions: How would i handle a stressful situation?

title: Behavioral Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Douglasville, GA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was an open interview day. There was a short presentation then we toured the facility then they asked many scenario questions. Staff seemed nice and open but I have read about bad reviews about lack of communication between staff
Interview Questions: When was a difficult time you had to disagree with someone you worked with and how did you handle it

title: Foster Care Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 different interviews.  It was a bit much for one position.  The pay isn't a lot, but it sounds like a good job to get your feet wet.
Interview Questions: What if questions.

title: Behavior Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Douglasville, GA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a Leadership Team Member. The questions that was asked for more about the staff verses the children.  We was able to do a observation of the program and housing for the children
Interview Questions:
What if you have child that constantly say they going to kill you everyday you come to work. How would you handle that situation?

What you have a staff member that do not like you and you are a situation were you need help? In addition, you ask the staff member for help but she do not help you because she do not like you.

title: Family Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was with the recruiter and they asked some very basic questions to see if you are qualified.  You will also be given the opportunity to ask them clarifying questions to see if you want to continue.  After that, there is a second interview with a manager that is very flexible (video chat interview allowed if you are a long distance away)
Interview Questions: Family scenario questions

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Johnson City, TN) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: They scheduled a phone interview and asked basic questions regarding your experience, skills, and education relevant for the job and had one case scenario. Next, a couple days later I was called for a second interview face to face and the interview consisted of about 25 behavioral based questions and one case scenario, lasted for about an hour. The interviewer then wanted to get me straight in to the third interview while I was there but she could not because they were tied up with something else. She said that she would call me soon. The next business day I received a letter stating that unfortunately, I did not meet the requirements. I would not waste my time with this company. It's a waste of time and effort just to be led on.
Interview Questions: What does family intervention specialist mean to you?

title: Mobile Crisis Response Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was the first interview.  I was asked about my experience with crisis and then asked how I would handle a case scenario.  I was also asked about any de-eacalation techniques that I have been trained in, and how I would go about de-escalating a situation.
Interview Questions: How does your experience prepare you for this position?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: YV reached out to me via email. I had a brief screening interview with a representative from the headquarters. After I was asked to apply and a few days later I had a phone interview from a representative from the location I applied to and a skype interview with the hiring manager the day after that. Interviews went well, very conversational instead of interrogative. Staff was very nice and honest about the details of the position. Interview consisted of questions about clinical, supervisory, work place experience, and a few case scenarios.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you received criticism that you did not agree with? What would your biggest challenge would be working in this position?

title: In Home Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions:
2 brief phone interviews, 1 in person interview
My process was very speedy, I had two phone calls with someone in the office asking about my experience and my interest and then I was brought in for an in person interview. This consisted of 2 supervisors and myself. In the interview I got to learn abou the Youth Villages treatment model and was asked case based questions. I got an offer the following day!
Interview Questions: Most of the questions came in the form of case vignettes in which the interviewee would have to respond to with an intervention they think would be beneficial

title: Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was rushed and person spoke very rapidly. It was 5:30pm so perhaps they had dinner plans? I was given a brief overview of the company, quickly told about the benefit package, asked a couple of questions, and given the opportunity to "briefly" ask follow up questions before we moved on to the next section.  The interview then stated "if we're interested in giving you an offer you will hear back from us in about a week" and the call ended. The entire experience lasted about 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why am I leaving my current position? Why did I leave my former employer?

title: Behavioral Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview which went very well, was more of a back and forth with me answering questions then the interviewer giving me more information about the position and giving me time for questions that made it feel more like a conversation. Was contacted to come in for an in person interview only two days in advance, I replied and asked if there was another interview time available since I was currently attending school 9 hours away and had classes I could not miss during the week. Never received a response, emailed again saying when I would be in the area and asked if there was a possibility to come in then, still no response. Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Tell me a challenge you have faced in past work and how you overcame it.

title: Crisis Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It started with a phone interview and a face to face the next day. The following week I had the third interview and was offered the job the next day
Interview Questions: Questions involve crisis scenario and how you would handle it.

title: Youth Crisis Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Nashville, TN) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews. They’re trying to weed out if you’re capable of doing this job as it does require confidence and assertiveness. It’s a hard job.  You are faced with really tough decisions and they’ll ask questions to see how you will react.
Interview Questions: Would you send someone to the hospital who was suicidal?

title: IT Network Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was really good - till they just disappeared out of the blue with no explanation. They out-of-the-blue turned a job with full benefits to contract based. I was really confused on why, and never got a response from anyone working there.
Interview Questions: Logical help-desk related questions.

title: LifeSet Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Two step interview process. Scenarios given to understand your on the fly intervention development for youth. Word association exercise. Question and answer opportunity in regard to concerns and expectations of the job you are applying for.
Interview Questions: What role do you feel you would be best suited for as you indicated an interest in several positions.

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Portland, OR) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Three steps. First was a phone interview with a phone recruiter from a different state. He explained benefits, the job, and asked questions from my resume for me to elaborate on my experiences. Second was an interview with the regional director in my state. The third interview was with a clinical supervisor. The second and third interviews are spilt up between "regular" questions and clinical vignettes.
Interview Questions: Free associations... What do you think of when you hear these words and how do you think they'd impact your role at YV?: integrity, accountability, team building and two others I can't remember (one of which may have been leadership?)

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages (Southbridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Was a bit much. One would think that after 3 interviews with three different individuals you would be able to get the most qualified candidates and not just hire to fill positions and maintain numbers
Interview Questions:
You are given vignettes 
Then asked what you would do

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial phone screening and then two interviews in person. The first interview was very informative and transparent about the demands of the job. It seemed that the transparency was due to concern of their high turnover as a result of burnout.  I was told to expect to work over 40 hours with a non-negotiable salary of $35,000.  The interviewers were laid back and friendly. However, I was surprised at how in-depth the interview questions were for such an incredibly low-paying job. Be prepared for many crisis questions and vignettes. I felt that the interview went very well, however I was not offered a position. I politely requested feedback, but they were unwilling.
Interview Questions: They had two double-sided pages with questions.  Many questions were vignettes that were read off and then I had to explain the interventions I would set in place. They also asked to explain the words (integrity, persistence, engagement, team work).

title: Staff Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Woburn, MA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone screening, then a video conference interview, then a final interview with the hiring manager and a regional director (the interviewing process took about a month). After the final interview, I was told I would hear back in 1 week about their decision.  Unfortunately, the hiring manager felt that it wasn’t necessary to notify their applicants that they did not get the position. I sent an email 2 weeks after the final interview took place and never heard back. After all the time spent interviewing, I feel this is totally unprofessional and would not apply here again.
Interview Questions: Generic behavioral interview questions with a lot scenario questions

title: Transitional Living Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email to set up a time for a phone interview to talk more about the position. The interview lasted about an hour. I was told my information would be passed on to the person who makes the hiring decisions for more interviews.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to Youth Villages?

title: Social Worker/Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Tulsa, OK)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job over the weekend. By Monday, I had received an offer for a phone interview, which was actually more of a screening from a worker in Memphis, TN. I was asked about experience and given a few scenarios. The worker was not able to answer questions about the geographic areas within the state where I would be working. I was told I would be expected to be on call 24/7 for my clients which would number 4-6. I was also informed that there were around (3) one hour sessions per week required with each family, which had to be around the clients' schedules. The second phone interview, I was told I was expected to move within 15-20 of my clients residences. Since they still would not tell me what exact area that was in, I wondered how a company could possibly make that request. I ended the interview after that information was conveyed to me. Their expectations are the most ridiculous I've ever heard and the pay was very low.
Interview Questions: I was asked about what types of counseling I was experienced with and asked about specific scenarios and how I would respond. They asked if I knew how to make a treatment plan.

title: Teacher's Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Arlington, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: a phone interview, then an in-person interview during which you shadow a class for half an hour - during the interviews, i was asked about my past experience working with youth with emotional and behavioral disorders and if i knew anything about collaborative problem solving.
Interview Questions: Q: what do you know about collaborative problem solving?

title: LifeSet Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and immediately got an email requesting a phone interview. Interview was conducted within a couple of days. I was then told someone would be contacting me in a few days to set up an in-person interview. I didn't hear from anyone for about 2 weeks. To give them credit, the person who finally called apologized profusely and explained the reason for the delay. I had my in-person interview a few days later and was told I did a great job and that they would be in touch within a few days. I never heard from them again. Luckily, I received another job offer just after that so I took it but I felt this interview/hiring process was very poorly handled. At least give someone an answer either way.
Interview Questions:
Phone interview...standard questions (experience, interest level in work, etc.)
in-person interview was mostly scenarios and how I would handle the situations.

title: Transitional Living Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR who explained the position in detailed. Pay was Also discussed. Also asked me to expound on my experience and why I'm interested in working with the agency. She stated she was forwarding my app to the regional supervisor. A week later the regional supervisor contacted me for a phone interview. Phone interview was conducted the next day, & lasted an hour. Consisted of a series of questions; what made you interested in this agency, what experience or knowledge do you hold that would benefit this agency through this position, have you ever worked this target population and what are your long term goals. Then I was presented with to scenario questions. After my response to the first we stated she for she didn't need to do The second scenario due to how well I did in the first. The supervisor then expounded on the position and their expectations. Pay was explained in more detailed and the other perks; relocation assistance and etc. Was offered to shadow with A workerprior to interview. But due to the timing I was unable to commit to the shadowing on that particular day. Supervisor stated that was fine, that could easily be rescheduled.  A face to face interview was then scheduled for a few days later. Face to face interview last about 45 minutes. Interviewed with the regional supervisor and clinical supervisor. Very similar questions as before. 2 more scenario questions were asked too. Questions about previous collaboration and teamwork with current or old supervisor and employees in your previous or current position. Was informed of potential hire time, along with being informed that all interviwees would be informed of decision within another week. Currently awaiting decision
Interview Questions: what made you interested in this agency, what experience or knowledge do you hold that would benefit this agency through this position, have you ever worked this target population and what are your long term goals.

title: Intercept Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Nashville, TN) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed at the Nashville headquarters. By the time my interview took place the position was already filled, so they placed me on a list of candidates for other positions in the surrounding areas. My next interview was with the office I would be working in. It was a short easy interview with a calm atmosphere.
Interview Questions: To react to a case study and how you would move forward with the client.

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Oregon City, OR)
Interview Descriptions: You receive a phone interview from the Tennessee main office at which point they will refer you to an in person interview on site.  The Interview was with the regional supervisor.  They ask typical interview questions and have you complete some scenarios.
Interview Questions:
Experience working with youth
Experience being on call 24/7

title: Family Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: My interview took place over the phone. The interview started with a description of the job. Then my skills and educational experience were clarified. The interviewer was friendly and very frank about the long hours. At the end I was offered another interview however I decided this job would not be for me. The pay compared to the hours worked is very dismal. I appreciated their honesty as it helped me make a good decision for myself and Youth Villages.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about rotating on call in addition to your work week?

title: Transitional Living Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called for the initial phone interview within a few days. I was then contacted a few hours after the phone interview to schedule an in office intervand then called for the 3rd interview. At this one I was told the interviews would be completed that week and I would get a call whether or not I was the one selected. It's been 3 weeks and haven't heard anything. I'm OK with not being selected, however she should have kept her word and called.
Interview Questions: There was various scenario questions

title: Behavioral Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Douglasville, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was an open house interview. Each of us interviewed with different managers. During that, I was asked what age group did I prefer. After the interview, I was taken to a residential area where the age group I prefer lives to observe. After that, I was taken into a room with 2 managers, one of which was the supervisor of the zone I prefer. It consisted of questions that required both written & verbal answers.
Interview Questions: A 16yr old girl that got up after bedtime pacing in her room mumbling to herself. Once asked what's wrong she began yelling and scratching herself until she bled. How would you handle this situation?

title: Behavioral Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Bartlett, TN) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 phone interviews and an in-person interview onsite. My first phone interview was with a corporate recruiter and my in person interview and follow up phone interview were with my (later)manager.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Johnson City, TN) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth process. I was brought in after applying online. The first interview was by phone. I was asked a series of situational questions and then given a run down on what the position would be like. After passing this portion, I was brought in for an in person interview. This went well so I was moved on to another representative on site where I interviewed again. Very nice company that was very transparent about the challenges and benefits of the job.
Interview Questions: Situational questions about cases and asked how I would handle it.

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Paris, TN) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was relaxed, with many situational questions. There was a phone screening first with a hiring manager then they set up the in person interview with two supervisors. The entire interview lasted about one hour. The supervisor called with in a couple of days to tell me their decision.
Interview Questions: What would you do in specific situations.

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was an open house interview. I observed in a classroom and then I was interviewed by a panel of people.  It was easy to find and I felt welcomed by the staff and leadership.
Interview Questions: Name three traits of a good employee.

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview with two HR personnel was easy with rather simple questions. The total time for this interview was approximately 10 mins; yes, ten mins.

The second interview consisted of observing an all girls group of teens ages 14-17 as they participated in therapeutic recreation. Afterwards, I toured the facility and interviewed with a floor supervisor and program manager.
Interview Questions: A boy, 10 years old, has ADHD was called out while playing a game of kickball. He will not leave the base and insists he is not out. He begins to verbally attack playmates and spit on staff. How would you handle this situation?

title: Overnight Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really great. Very simplistic and quick. The interviewer was very open, and brief. The hiring process was quick. The first week of work was either an orientation for some or on the job training.
Interview Questions: None

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Arlington, MA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
To apply for a job you go online and fill out a pretty generic application. 

You then get an email or phone call asking you to come in

They call this an "open house interview". You come in and check in in the main building and are walked to a conference room (this is the same room you'll have weekly meetings & CPR and random movie nights when you're hired) 

They explain GL and the different programs on campus. Different managers come in and split people up. I had my interview in a group home. 

we went to their office and they asked me questions like, "what would you do if..." and "tell me about a situation when..."

Most people are hired on the spot. The turnover rate is crazy fast. 

There will then be a two week training in Woburn
Interview Questions: They asked me a lot of questions about how to prevent crisis situations. "A girl was mean to another girl and she seems really agitated"

title: Family Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was Tough. I was a bit nervous because the scenario questions were a little misleading. I tried as hard as possible to make sense of the scenarios and comprehend them as best as I could.
Interview Questions: A lot of different scenario questions.

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: I first submitted an application using their online system. I received an email from a recruiter shortly after, offering some potential times for a 10-15 minute phone interview. This phone interview ended up being the next morning. The recruiter was very friendly and personable. She was upfront and transparent about the salary - which would start at $36,000 and raise to $39,000 after the first year. The questions were not challenging. She told me she would like to pass me along to her supervisor for a second phone interview. I considered some of the information I received during this interview and when I received the call for the second interview, I declined. I decided I did not want to be on-call 24/7.
Interview Questions: You will manage a caseload of families whom you will need to visit throughout each week. Will you be able to travel between homes and potentially work evenings depending on client availability?

title: Night Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Arlington, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Due to the high turn-over rate, YV is always conducting interviews. You are first called from the headquarters in Nashville to obtain the preliminary information. You are then called by the local office to set up an in-person interview. Interview was basically a run down of what the program entails. As long as you pass a background and drug test, you will most likely get hired because they are so desperate for people
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at youth villages?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Green Bay, WI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: mostly company overview, salary, relocation reimbursement, work schedule.....starting wife $32,000 after one year $36,000, and after 2 years $39,000....relocation is pure reimbursement - $1,200 flat (includes everything...if you are asked to interview in person they expect the funds to travel come out of the $1,200) - seemed more like a "here is what we offer, if you like it complete the actual legal application online then you have an interview with a regional manager"...I believe this initial phone interview is merely to let people know how low the pay is
Interview Questions: Family: mother, grandmother, 16 year old son truancy and AODA challenges - what would you do to help family

title: Overnight Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Louisville, KY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received first over the phone interview and that lasted an hour. Found out on second over phone interview that first was just a screening interview. Scheduled third interview... So many interviews but everyone was nice, clear, and helpful. I was leery with so many bad reviews but understood you have to start somewhere
Interview Questions: How would you handle type questions... Multiple but each similar to what others on this site said.

title: Foster Care Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy. They asked the questions you would expect any organization to ask. It was casual and relaxed. I was struck by their honesty about the difficulty of the role and also, why their retention rate is so low right now. Near the end of the interview I was given two scenarios and asked how I would respond to them and I believe this plays a huge role in their assessment of your skill set/knowledge base for the position.
Interview Questions: (1) why are you interested in this role? (2) what do you bring to the table? (3) what would you find challenging about this work?

title: Teacher I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: It was a very cordial, relaxed process; however, a computer glitch voided my eligibility for the position.  I had to do the groundwork to correct this issue with little initiative from the company.  A phone interview was later followed by a group interview and informational meeting.  A 1-on-1 interview was the final step.  All portions of the process were relaxed and friendly.  I had a feeling that high turnover contributed to the mass of people hired from my cohort.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a child in crises during class?

title: Life Skills Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Portland, OR) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief interview where I was asked basic interview questions, strengths/weaknesses, experience, scheduling, how I would handle certain situations with clients, If I have worked with an at-risk population, driving record
Interview Questions: If a client asked who I was voting for president, what would I say?

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Called in for a first interview, where we went over exactly what YV does, the age group, behavioral problems of the clients and the details of the TC position (went well) a week later called in for an observation of the girls and a second interview. Observation time was very important to really see how everything is done.
Interview Questions: Three words to describe yourself.

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: face to face 30 minute interview. then a quick tour of facility and 1 hour sit in with other employees. Face to face with the manager that will be over you and your location. A quick review of the rules and youth.
Interview Questions: what makes you the right person to work for youth villages?

title: Night Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Portland, OR) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was then contacted via email for a phone interview by a recruiter. Spoke for about 40 minutes, the job was outlined and pay and schedule were touch on. then the interviewer opened it up to any questions I had.. very relaxed and easy, recruiter was open and honest. I declined to move further as the job didn't completely match up to my career goals.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a resident that is upset and disturbing other residents while they sleep?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Initial call from an HR rep who is very nice. They explain benefits and salary. 
Call from local office hiring manager, which would be the clinical leadership team. 
Team asks "what if?" questions. Team asks experience with and opinions on different job responsibilities.
Interview Questions: What to do in certain situations...

title: YVLifeSet Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Columbia, TN) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about previous experience, and given scenarios in how I would handle them. We discussed how I handled stressful situations in the past, and how I would handle them in the position for which I was interviewing. We talked about self-care, and my personal coping skills. We talked about a description of the job, and whether I felt like I was a good fit. I also came with questions about the organization, opportunities for advancement, and tuition reimbursement.
Interview Questions: Describe when you had a difficult time with a supervisor.

title: Behavior Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online three weeks before an initial phone contact. The recruiter called me and explained the low salary wage. She stated that employees for this particular position had to work one  weekend day of 16hrs( Saturday or Sunday 6am-10pm). She scheduled a phone interview about my work experiences, interest in the job, and my ability to perform the job.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a disruptive client?

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Bartlett, TN) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: You go through two interviews. The first is an overview of what you will "supposedly" be doing. The second interview is an observation of the facility, specifically the girls or boys you will be working with.
Interview Questions:
Why should we hire you?
Are you comfortable restraining children?
Name a time you had to do etc...?
Have you ever worked in this environment?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Worcester, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: 3 hour long phone interview with one of the direct supervisors. She asked plenty of clinical, senerio based questions. Really intense but she tried to make it as painless as possible.
Interview Questions: What would you do if...

title: Night Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Lake Oswego, OR) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very professional and positive, and they had me spend about thirty minutes observing and interacting with clients to get a feel for what the job would be like.  This was the luck of the draw that I wasn't observing during a crisis situation.  Interview ended up lasting overall about an hour and half including the observation time.
Interview Questions: How do you handle crisis situations?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position and was contacted within 24 hrs by a recruiter I then had an interview with a supervisor by phone and then flew from out of state for the face to face interview with 3 management personnel the process took 2 weeks from start to finish.
