They started off the last interview saying they wanted someone with a masters which isn't in the description nor was it said in the first 2 interviews. This was especially irritating since I paid for the last minute flight assuming things were going well and I actually was qualified. Note: I have a bachelors in psychology and a year and a half of case management experience for a non profit.
Interview Questions: 3 scenario questions in each interview. One example: there is a 5 yr old who is ok at school but at home is aggressive the mom is not present at sessions what do you do?

title: Behavioral Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Douglasville, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview proceeds was very easy. They just ask a lot of scenario questions. Just be sure of what you're saying. Don't sound as though you're asking or waiting for the interviewer to assure you that your answer is correct. Is very relaxed, felt more like a conversation on all interviews than interviews.
Interview Questions: If you had to facilitate a group with boys who's ages range from 12-18 what would be the name of the group and what would the topic be?

title: Behavioral Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Portland, OR) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a 30-minute phone interview with a HR person in the mid-west.  We talked about the specific position and benefits, schedule and salary.  Unfortunately this position only paid $11.50/hour, which would be extremely tight, if at all possible, in the Portland area.  She gave me a few days to think about it after the interview to decide if I wanted to move forward.  I withdrew my application.
Interview Questions: Would you be comfortable intervening physically with a child if needed and after completing training?

title: Teacher/Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter from Youth Villages after submitting an application. The process began with an online interactive seminar followed by a Q and A opportunity for more information. I was later email an invitation to an 'Open House' to a group home where I was to observe the staff and interact with the clients who lived there. After the session was over, an additional interview was supposed to have been conducted but the person who was to do the interview was needed to transport a child and no one else was available. I attempted to reschedule at a later date and was unsuccessful as my calls were not returned. I later recieved an email that said the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: I was asked what type of activities would I be able to conduct with the girls in the unit.

title: Bilingual Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Douglas, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was in-person at GA location. Interview consisted of lots of "describe a situation where you were..." , questions about your personal style and scenario questions. A LOT of scenario questions. They gave you a scenario and asked open-ended questions about what you would do, what approach you would take, etc.
Interview Questions: Describe a scenario where someone gave you feedback that you didn't agree with.

title: Family Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview about 30 minutes long. Asked about relevant job experience and education. The woman was friendly, however they were upfront about the low pay and long work hours associates with the position
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to overcome a challenge at work

title: Family Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Asheville, NC) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview. This was after an initial phone screen. The process went well and was quite casual until the end when I was asked several scenario questions. I received a form e-mail saying that I had not been selected. It was quite polite but obviously impersonal. I think the fact that I asked very specific questions about the workload, schedule and that I brought up the horrible reviews of the company didn't help much. LOL. Probably not for me anyway. It had an "indentured servant" feel to it because of the promise of paid supervision provided you work for 2 years IN ADDITION to the years it takes you to become fully licensed or else pay back the company. With the starting salary of 34k...no thanks anyway. I have to pay back my student loans somehow.
Interview Questions: "You are working with a client and his mother calls you saying he is threatening to hurt her. How do you handle the situation"

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is extremely laborious. I went through 2 interviews for one position then 2 interviews for one that the staff thought better suited me (the Teacher-Counselor) only to find out after a month-long process that I didn't get the job. The HR Director gave me no answer as to the reason. I later found out it was probably due to the fact that I had a speeding ticket on my background check. I think it was cowardly for them not to be honest about it.
Interview Questions: Typical: What are your strengths and weaknesses? How do you handle stress? They gave scenarios and asked how would you handle this situation?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Johnson City, TN)
Interview Descriptions: I met with the regional supervisor for the department. Job expectations and typical problems were discussed. My resume and education was reviewed. I was then given a scenario and asked to discuss what needed to be addressed and in which order. I was asked to describe barriers that I have overcome and struggles that I have experienced in the office.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress in the workplace.

title: Family Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was full of "what-if" type questions that were simple to answer.  Interviewer was up front about schedule and pay.  The pay was VERY low and the schedule was terrible.  You were REQUIRED (even on off days) to drive patients places on your own time, no over time given.  The position would be great for a person without kids and should most likely be single.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have disciplining children?

title: Overnight Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Bartlett, TN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied and they contacted me by email first, I was then called and was scheduled a phone interview. On the day of my phone interview it lasted about 30 minutes. Phone interview consist of questions about you, your experience, followed by scenario questions. I was then scheduled a second interview and observation. I came in the afternoon hours (when the kids are out of school) to observe for about 20 minutes then I went back with the interviewer and was asked questions about what I observed, more scenario questions, and questions about what kind of activities I would do with the kids.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a kid spit on you? What you would tell a child if their parents couldn't come visit them on their birthday? ( all of these questions is something you have to actually deal with) What's your definition of self control (very important question) because you have to have a lot of self control when dealing with difficult children and times of crisis.

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions:
I was called about 2 days after I applied online by a woman in the Tennessee area.She gave me a few options as to what job I was interested since I applied for more than one. She asked me basic questions about my experience and then gave me a scenario to answer. The scenario was about conflict and she wanted to know how I would have handled it. 

She then stated the hours and salary. Afterwards she stated I may get a call back within 7 days once she sends over my info to the hiring manager for the position. I got a call back a few days later from the hiring manager. That was last week. Today I will be interviewing over the phone.
Interview Questions: How to handle difficult youth

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Knoxville, TN) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online in Feb. Received an email & phone call for initial interview. I was told it would be a 2-3 month process. Went back for a second interview about 2 months after the initial contact.  The follow up call which happened in the next week informed me the position wouldn't be open until July when I thought the position would be end of April/May. I was disappointed but understanding.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to quit your current job?

title: Outreach Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: A re ruiter contacted me and notified me that I had shown interest in the Tennessee area and then asked me if I would consider working in the Massachusetts office. Then she did an initial interview over the phone. Than a week later did a phone interview with a supervisor. Then allowed me to interview in person in two weeks. After being interviewed I was notified within the week that I would be hired.
Interview Questions: Experience in working with at risk youth. Also alot of scenario questions

title: Behavioral Youth Counselor (Teacher Counselor) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions:
Several days after applying online, I received a short phone interview. It was very relaxed and simple questions such as any experience I had in the field, etc. Afterwards I was asked when I would be available for a face to face interview.

1 week later I met with my interviewer. I showed up 15 minutes early, yet my interviewer was roughly 15 minutes late. He was very casually dressed, and the interview was not at all what I expected. The whole experience was very unprofessional, as he would constantly look at his phone or mess with his computer, showing little interest.

After the interview I set up a date less than a week later for an orientation (walk about) at the group home I would be working at. Over all the experience went well.

The final step was a second interview, where I was asked more scenario questions, focusing more on my willingness to physically detain an uncompliant  youth. Once again the interview was unprofessional, and the interviewer seemed distracted and uninterested. Afterwards I was told he would call me later that evening to let me know if I received the job or not......never heard from him again.
Interview Questions: Given short scenarios to see how you would react and handle a situation.

title: Youth Care Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: The first step in the process was a short phone interview with a recruiter where I was asked about my experience working in mental health and particularly about my experience with crisis management. The recruiter typed notes to record my answers and told me that I may or may not be contacted for the next part of the interview process. A few days later, I was contacted by a program director at the Germaine Lawrence campus and scheduled an in-person interview. I interviewed with one manager for about 40 minutes and then did a brief classroom observation. After the observation, I interviewed with another manager for about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: What part of the job requirements do you think you would struggle the most with?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via phone to schedule an initial interview with an HR manager from HQs. I then conducted another phone interview with the regional manager and was invited to an in person interview in the local office. The interviews consisted of case studies and questions but were relatively easy.
Interview Questions: The interviews consist of case studies in which you are asked questions about how you would handle them.

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: I'm still in the interview process. I've had the phone interview and I have an in person interview next week. The phone interview was pretty simple and laid back. Job duties and salary were discussed. I was asked how I would handle different scenarios.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a child who became irate?

title: Transitional Living Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: I've had the pre screening interview, afterwards I was told I would be contacted 7-10 business days after that. I've been emailing and calling about the second interview.....no response. I'm kind of frustrated because they are giving me the blues about my second interview that was suppose to be THREE WEEKS AGO
Interview Questions: Question were fair

title: Family Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: There is an initial phone interview, then an in-person interview. They replied back quickly and stayed in contact with me of I had any questions.  Everyone I interacted with was pleasant and helpful. They assisted with finding the situation that worked best for me. They were open to listen to questions and concerns, and were honest about the disadvantages of the job.
Interview Questions: Name a time you were faced with a confrontation; how did you handle it?

title: Specialized Crisis Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: There was a telephone 'screening interview,' followed by in person interviews with local management. The telephone interview was weird! The interviewer was constantly pausing without explanation. I understand 'pausing' to be an interview tactic, but this was beyond that. The interviews left me with a strong impression that the company is a tad disorganized. I think most non-profits are the same way though, so I didn't draw any bias from that.
Interview Questions: They present scenarios during the interview and ask what you would do in that scenario.

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Call with interviewer on the phone then had a group interview with a home director and someone else.  I was honest and upfront. I believe one of the ladies was texting on her phone during the interview though.
Interview Questions: The biggest questions they ask about is situations that really happen and see how you respond. My interviewer told me when it was over that they were looking at my ability to think outside of the box.

title: Clinical Care Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Madison, IN) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed on the phone twice and was asked to come in for a face to face interview with the regional manager and regional supervisor. I did not meet my immediate supervisor until the job was already secured. I was first contacted by a recruiter out of Nashville and was later contacted by the regional manager for a phone interview.
Interview Questions: They asked about how I handle conflict, situations dealing with containing my shock. They asked about my experience with being on-call and with managing crisis situations. In addition, they had the supervisor on the phone to ask any questions she felt were necessary for the job.

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty easy and convenient. I was part of a large college group and they brought managers to all come together in the operations center to interview us. I was nervous and a bit unprepared but I was able to get through it by being very personable.
Interview Questions: Information about the company because i was confused about the numerous facilities

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Knoxville, TN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with regional supervisors, two over the course of 3 interviews. Mainly the regional managers wanted to make sure that this was the right fit for me and my family. They were very open and clear about expectations and after the 3 step interview process they made me an offer.
Interview Questions: What makes you think that Youth Villages is the right fit for you?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: I was initially contacted by a phone recruiter who directed me to complete on-line application steps separate from my initial submission through the Youth Villages website. After I completed this section, I was scheduled for an initial interview and also a second interview. High intensity in  communication was maintained by phone and email before, between, and after interviews. Staff were professional and supportive in the process.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question were scenario questions concerning specific clinical skill processes concerning potentially resistant clients.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Sent in my application and received an email a few weeks later about an interview. Scheduled a phone interview with Sister Barbara, who was very kind and friendly. The interview lasted about 30ish minutes. The questions weren't hard at all; it was more like a chat. Heard back a few months later about being hired.
Interview Questions: If you were an animal, what animal would you be? (not difficult, just unexpected because it came randomly towards the end)

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was first contracted by phone. Then later I had two face to face interviews. The interviews were far and in between ... It took almost 3 months ... I was offered the position... Please ask questions a lot. There are some things you may have to do extra with auto insurance.
Interview Questions: Plenty of scenario questions ... Remembers to think about safety first

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Douglasville, GA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the company recruiter for the Douglasville, Georgia campus. I spoke with her, Amanda Jordan and submitted to her my resume, references, and cover letter. I spoke with her on the phone to answer a few preliminary questions about the job. I answered questions about my availability and about my willingness to work odd hours. I was invited, after a few days, by email, to the main campus to tour it and to conduct and in-person interview. This interview consisted of questions about my education and prior work experiences. It also included questions about hypothetical scenarios involving youth and about how I would react/respond to them. I heard back from Amanda Jordan approximately two weeks later, requesting my college transcript and inviting me back to campus for observation of the unit I was applying to work with. After observation, and one last talk with Amanda about how the observation went, along with a question and answer round, I was told I had gotten the job! I went through two weeks of training and orientation and a week of on the job training before I was considered a full-time employee.
Interview Questions: Have you ever encountered a situation with a child that you did not feel as though you could handle and what did you do about it?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Morristown, TN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: 1st interview not ready. Management was rushed. Multitasking during interview about clients and situations. Gave case scenarios and how would I handle the situation. Interview was quick and interrupted through whole process.
Interview Questions: Case study  scenerio

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Applied Online.  Received follow-up within 48 hours of applying.  Phone interview conducted 48 hours after initial follow-up.  Invited for face-to-face interview at the end of phone interview.  Face-to-face interview was conducted two days after phone interview.  Job offer presented at the end of face-to-face interview.  Start date was one week after face-to-face interview.  Quick process.
Interview Questions: If you do your research on the YV interview process and the models they implement (MST and Intercept model) then you will know what to expect.  Scenario questions make up a large portion of phone and face-to-face interview ("How would you handle this situation?")

title: Behavioral Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for opportunities for future graduates in March or 2013. I was contacted through Email and scheduled a phone interview. the phone interview was 30 minutes and the recruiter asked questions about your experience and what you would do in certain situations. When it ended, she invited me to an "open house" to learn more about the organization and to interview again. I went to the open house and was seated with about seven other people. We were greeted by the recruiter and she explained a lot about Youth Villages. Afterwards, we were lead to a room where many of the hiring managers were located and we were spread out to various managers for interviews. the interview consisted of a manager asking us a set of questions on a list. 

After we were finished, they spread us out into specific facilities that we would be working at to "observe" the program and the other counselors and the kids. I sat there for about an hour watching the kids before a manager got me and told me I could go home. he said he would call within the next week, though after about three weeks I finally heard from him and was asked to come do paperwork. I went in and he told me I had to go get my fingerprints and a drug screen, then he would call me again. I did that and never heard from him again, despite trying to contact him. After about three weeks since the drug screen, a manager from another campus called me to tell me the campus I interviewed for had filled their positions, and that I could try and get into that campus. 

I scheduled an interview and drove up to the new campus. I met with the manager in the office and had a terrible interview. The manager was asking me questions while surfing through his email and checking his phone. It was really unprofessional. After the interview, I observed this campus for an hour until the manager told me I could leave. It was another three weeks before I finally got a rejection email.
Interview Questions: How do you define self-discipline?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Columbia, TN) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The first interview gives you details on salary and expectations as well as benefits. Keep in mind you can not work for Youth Villages if you have more than two traffic violations in the past three years. After you phone interview with the recruiter if you decide to move further they will help you move forward in the next steps which is another interview. I did not move past this step due to the relocation reimbursement not being what I expected and inability to move quickly.
Interview Questions: Being given a scenario  with limited information and asked how would you handle this situation and which techniques would you use.

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: There were two phone interviews, one with HR in Tennessee, and one with the regional director, and then one in person interview with the director of the local office. Most questions were scenario based, but also some normal interview questions such as "tell me about your experience." Overall this process was very easy. The questions were straight forward, and as long as you are focused on the family system when formulating your answers, you're likely to get the job.
Interview Questions: They provided several scenarios of families you might encounter during service, and asked how you handle each case.

title: Primary Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Tupelo, MS) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was slightly long. There were three interview. One by phone and then two with regional supervisors. The phone interview was with the hiring manager/recruiter initially. Then there was an group open house type of situation that included a presentation about the program from current managers and then two interviews. Only those who were succeful in the first face-to-face, were asked to stay for a second interview.
Interview Questions: The questions were situational and case example in type. They gave you scenarios and wanted to see how you would help the families.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews for my current job at Youth Villages. I was asked a lot of questions about my job and my views of the organization.
Interview Questions: What would you do in such and such a situation?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy, some questions over work history but primarily focused on scenarios and how I would handle various situations.  This occurred in both the telephone interview and the face-to-face.
Interview Questions: It was really the scenarios.  You were not allowed to ask for additional information on the family/client and you were not briefed on company policy.  So when a scenario begins with "you have been working with a family for 3 months and <blank> happens, what do you do?" it makes it difficult as a clinician to not have additional information because hopefully after 3 months you would have a pretty good idea.  This should have been a warning that in the job, every situation has a specific response that is in no way based on clinical understanding or the therapeutic relationship.

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I dud a phone interview then i did a in person interview.  We did orientation.  During orientation we did a walk through on campus. They also taught us how to drive the sprinter vans .....
Interview Questions: How to handle a child in crisis.

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a total of four Interviews. I had one phone screening and the other three were face to face. All were in a cool, welcoming environment. Most were at the various offices they had around the Memphis area.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were scenarios and "what would you do" type instances.

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Youth Villages
Interview Descriptions: Are you breathing and seem appropriate.
Interview Questions: Gave you scenarios and saw how you would handle it.

title: Family Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Washington, DC) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had a pre-screening interview over the phone. It was awkward and the man conducting the interview sounded as though he were reading material/questions from a sheet of paper.
Interview Questions: I was given a scenario and asked about the strengths of the family, what my interventions would be, etc. He read the question quickly and I was left a bit flustered by it.

title: Transitional Living Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Woburn, MA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Phase one interview was over the phone and asked basic information about educational and professional experience. Phone interview also gave a rundown of basic functions of the position including day to day duties, schedule and benefits

Phase two was an additional phone interview that asked more  questions about my professional experience including strengths and career related goals. What I hope to get from the job. 

phase three was a face to face interview where I completed a series of vignettes and discussed more about the position.
Interview Questions: The vignettes were the most challenging part of the interview, if you have no experience.

title: Bilingual Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Boston, MA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: My interview was today and it was horrible! the man who interviewed me was great ! but my cellphone went out on him twice during the interview when I called back I didn't get a response so I know I didn't get this job at all and I know I am qualified for the job. I sent him a thank you and sorry note
Interview Questions: What do you need improvement on.

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Johnson City, TN) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Went through a 2 interview process that was behaviorally focused (e.g., tell me about a time when...). Second interview contained a case-scenario and I was given a specific situation and asked what I would address first, second, etc and why.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you encountered a conflict at work and had to solve it.

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had two phone interviews and then one in person where they had me drive accross the country for a half an hour in one room where they officially said they hired me. It was never in the job description given to me to be on call 24 hours a day.
Interview Questions: They didn't really ask any difficult or unexpected questions. There were a lot of scenarios and I guess I wasn't really expecting that.

title: Direct Care Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Douglasville, GA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: One on one discussion.  They just review your resume with you.  Then decide if they want to give you an offer.  Then they bring you in for orientation and training, which take 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Internet application. Phone conversation to schedule in person interview. Possible second interview to determine team setting.
Interview Questions: They use situation and role playing formats for many questions.

title: Residential Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Linden, TN) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: It seemed a little "hoaky", I was given the company vision statement and told to write what it meant to me??? They seemed more interested in my willingness to "put hands on" a kid than my interest or involvment with kids. Most of the staff seemed distant or half there. Interview process is long and takes two weeks for orientation in another city.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a kid hit you and then spit on you?

title: Direct Service Provider Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The one on one interview was hard. They asked lots behavioral questions. Be prepared to answer case study questions as well. They give you scenarios and you must explain to them what you would do in extreme situations with the students involved.
Interview Questions: How would you prioritize this situation? If a student was attempting to jump out of the window, while one student threatens to harm themselves while two students are getting into a physical altercation?

title: Behavioral Health Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Initial communications were positive, and response time was quick for all questions. Initially started with a phone pre-screen- included job overview, responsibilities, etc. Then moved on to second interview-face to face, with role playing scenarios involved. Once this was complete- asked to shadow current employees in day to day activities. Afterwards, offered the job, pending drug test.

Quick, simple, and easy.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a specific situation where a child attacks you physically

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Memphis, TN) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty good process.  They made sure new staff had the chance to observe the youth and the setting that they could potentially be working in.   The orientation was fun.  It takes a while for your background check to come back and you have to get fingerprinted and take a physical.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I were to do a presentation on problem sexual behaviors; what would I do?

title: Family Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: YV has a long hireing process. In my case it took near a month form the first interview. The office manager was mostly unreachable after 25 to 30 calls per week trying too get a person to update you on the process. The interview was mostly relevant to the position and consisted of 'what would you do in this situation' type questions. Safety is overemphasised and engagment and alignment is everything (even when it is not).
Interview Questions: They read cases too you and ask you to verbally analyze and develop a treatment plan. They want to know your thiking behind the treatment plan, SAFETY above and beyond and ranking of what you should do first ad so on.

title: Teacher Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Arlington, MA) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: Short group interview followed by simple personal interview. If you get the interview you'll het the job
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Family Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Villages (Johnson City, TN) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: 1st interview ended up being a group interview. No questions were asked, it was more for telling about the company. A second face to face interview was pretty basic, mostly reviewing resume and experience.  No unexpected questions. The only thing I didn't like was that I did no interview with the person who would be my direct supervisor and I actually only got to meet her once for about 30 seconds during the interview process.
Interview Questions: Would you be ok working under a supervisor who had less experience and less education than you?
